Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2016 03:40PM cubbieblue wrote: Thanks for the responses everyone. What you say makes perfect sense! I guess when people are claiming that they did or did not do chemo because of their age, there are actually things other than age being considered as well. It disturbed me to hear women my age (mid 50s) foregoing chemo at their MO's recommendation based on their age. They must not be mentioning the other factors that went into their decisions.
Posts.Title: Age as it relates to chemo cubbieblue BrooksideVT

Posts.Content: cubbieblue wrote: I've seen some people post that their team has recommended chemo "due to their age," and conversely others state that they were able to skip chemo due to their age. I really don't understand how age in itself is a deciding factor as to chemo. Can someone explain the rationale behind that? Thanks. Dx 10/6/2014, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 2/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 11/5/2014 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Chemotherapy 1/6/2015 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 5/11/2015 Whole-breast Hormonal Therapy 6/30/2015 Arimidex (anastrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Age as it relates to chemo cubbieblue BrooksideVT

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2015 08:43PM cubbieblue wrote: Thanks Dacre!  The irritation on my scalp has calmed down a little bit today, but the itching at my back hairline has now turned to red bumps.  I wonder if it is a reaction to the drugs.  I see the MO tomorrow so I will be sure to show him.  I'm Day 7 and so far no hair loss, but I'm thinking of taking the scissors to my head.  Your mohawk dream has me thinking...maybe I will have a little fun with it before it disappears. :-).
Posts.Title: Starting cytoxan and taxotere January 2015 Lindsincowtown Lindsincowtown

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2015 11:56AM cubbieblue wrote: Hello All, I completed Round 1 of Cytoxan and Taxotere this week.  My scalp is red and  irritated and I have itching on the hairline near my neck.  Dacre, are those symptoms of the hair getting ready to fall out?  Other symptoms have been manageable, but I have a hard time getting comfortable due to muscle aches, shooting pains and, constipation.  I thought these drugs were going to give me diarrhea, but the opposite has been true so far.  Did anyone else get a bad sinus headache from the Cytoxan?
Posts.Title: Starting cytoxan and taxotere January 2015 Lindsincowtown Lindsincowtown

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2016 12:32AM cubbieblue wrote: Sidharta, my small hypoechoic lobulated birads 3 assymetry at 9:00 proved to be cancer when biopsied at 6-month follow-up. Because imaging is far from precise, I don't think I will ever again wait six months to biopsy a new finding that falls in the "probably" category. Hope things turn out benign for you.
Posts.Title: Can you help me understand my results please? sidharta

Posts.Content: May 8, 2016 04:58PM cubbieblue wrote: Jane75 do you know which chemo drugs they are recommending? I was also a grade 2, high risk mammaprint, and had four rounds of Taxotere and Cytoxen. It was not nearly as bad as I anticipated, and was able to work most days. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Fearing Chemo Jane75 Jane75

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2015 04:19PM cubbieblue wrote: Jackbirdie, my Oncotype score is also 30 and we are about the same age.  Like Keepthefaith said, I would check into the Mammaprint test which does not have the intermediate category.  My Mammaprint put me at high risk and showed that I would benefit from the chemotherapy. To be honest, I was probably going to take the additional 4% benefit indicated by Oncotype and do the chemo either way.  Let me know if you have any other questions I can try to answer for you.   Best of luck to you.
Posts.Title: Decision time- Oncotype dx 30 Jackbirdie Jackbirdie
